title: Wynwood Art Walk
shortWhy: The original Miami art walk, better than Second Saturday crowds.
editorialWhy: Skip the packed Second Saturday scene. This Friday walk lets you actually talk to gallery owners and see the art without fighting through crowds. Start at Margulies Collection and work your way south.
description: Self-guided tour through Wynwood's galleries and street art. Over 70 galleries open their doors with new exhibitions, live music, and food trucks throughout the district.

title: Sunset Yoga at Bayfront Park
shortWhy: Downtown's best free workout with a killer bay view.
editorialWhy: Forget expensive studio classes. Bring your own mat and join locals for this donation-based flow. The sunset over the water is worth the commute alone.
description: Free community yoga class overlooking Biscayne Bay. All levels welcome. Bring your own mat and water. Donation suggested but not required.

title: Ball & Chain Live Salsa Night
shortWhy: The real Little Havana salsa scene, not the tourist trap version.
editorialWhy: This 1930s venue survived the neighborhood's changes and now hosts the city's best live salsa. Free salsa lessons at 8pm if you're nervous. The mojitos are excellent.
description: Live salsa band performs in this historic Little Havana venue. Free salsa lessons earlier in the evening. Full bar with Cuban cocktails and small plates.

title: Coconut Grove Farmers Market
shortWhy: Miami's oldest farmers market, and still the best.
editorialWhy: Saturday morning tradition since the '70s. The local honey vendor is a must, and grab breakfast from Lokal's food truck. Bring cash for smaller vendors.
description: Weekly farmers market featuring local produce, artisan goods, prepared foods, and live music. Over 100 vendors including local farms, bakeries, and craft makers.

title: Rooftop Jazz at East Miami
shortWhy: Brickell's best rooftop, especially when there's live jazz.
editorialWhy: The drinks are pricey but the view of the city skyline makes up for it. Get there by 6pm to snag a good seat before the jazz starts. Dress code enforced.
description: Live jazz trio performs on the 40th floor rooftop overlooking Brickell and the bay. Asian-inspired cocktails and small plates available.

title: Design District Gallery Night
shortWhy: High-end gallery openings without the Art Basel crowds.
editorialWhy: The Design District's answer to Wynwood's walks is more curated and less chaotic. ICA Miami is always worth a stop, and the public art installations are underrated.
description: Monthly gallery night with extended hours at Design District galleries, complimentary refreshments, and new exhibition openings.

title: South Beach Running Club
address: Ocean Dr & 10th St, Miami Beach, FL 33139
shortWhy: Beat the beach crowds with an early morning run.
editorialWhy: 5K along the boardwalk followed by optional beach workout. The sunrise over the ocean is the payoff. Coffee after at the nearby Cuban spot.
description: Free community run along South Beach boardwalk. All paces welcome. Meet at the lifeguard stand at 10th Street. Cool-down stretching and beach exercises optional.

title: Domino Park Sunset
shortWhy: Watch the OGs play dominoes in the heart of Little Havana.
editorialWhy: This is the real Calle Ocho experience, not the tourist traps. Grab a colada from the ventanita across the street and watch the masters play. Photography is welcome but be respectful.
description: Iconic outdoor domino park where local Cuban-Americans gather daily. Visitors welcome to watch the games. Adjacent to Calle Ocho restaurants and cafes.

title: Wynwood Brewing Thursday Trivia
shortWhy: Solid local beer and actually challenging trivia.
editorialWhy: Miami's first craft brewery still holds its own. The trivia isn't dumbed down and the La Rubia is perfect for our climate. Teams of up to 6, get there early.
description: Weekly trivia night at Miami's original craft brewery. Prizes for top teams. Full beer menu and food available. No cover charge.

title: Vizcaya Moonlight Tour
shortWhy: See Vizcaya how it was meant to be seen—under moonlight.
editorialWhy: Skip the daytime crowds and heat. These evening tours are limited capacity and let you experience the gardens with dramatic lighting. Book ahead, they sell out.
description: Special after-hours access to Vizcaya's Italian Renaissance gardens and waterfront grounds. Guided tour includes history and architecture. Limited capacity.

title: Key Biscayne Paddleboard Meetup
shortWhy: Calm bay waters perfect for paddleboarding, especially mornings.
editorialWhy: The protected bay side of Key Biscayne has flatter water than the beach. Rentals available on site, but bring your own if you have one. Look for manatees in winter.
description: Group paddleboard session in the calm waters of Biscayne Bay. Rental boards available. All skill levels welcome. Beautiful mangrove scenery.

title: Brickell City Centre Happy Hour
shortWhy: Uruguayan grill meets Brickell rooftop.
editorialWhy: The Miami outpost of Uruguay's legendary beach restaurant. Happy hour prices make the normally expensive cocktails accessible. The empanadas are non-negotiable.
description: Happy hour specials at this acclaimed Uruguayan restaurant. Discounted cocktails and appetizers on the terrace overlooking Brickell.

title: Little Haiti Cultural Center Concert
shortWhy: Authentic Haitian music in the heart of the community.
editorialWhy: This cultural center hosts incredible concerts that most Miami residents don't know about. The Caribbean market next door is worth arriving early for.
description: Live performance featuring Haitian and Caribbean musicians. Part of the center's ongoing cultural programming. Food vendors on site.

title: Oleta River Kayak Trail
address: 3400 NE 163rd St, North Miami Beach, FL 33160
shortWhy: Florida's largest urban park with miles of mangrove trails.
editorialWhy: Escape the city without leaving the city. The mangrove kayak trails are peaceful and you'll see herons, maybe manatees. Rent kayaks at the park entrance.
description: Self-guided kayak exploration through mangrove trails in Florida's largest urban park. Kayak rentals available. Wildlife viewing opportunities.

title: Coral Gables Wine Walk
shortWhy: Downtown Coral Gables becomes walkable wine country.
editorialWhy: One ticket gets you tastings at participating restaurants along Miracle Mile. The vibe is more grown-up than Wynwood's scene. Wear comfortable shoes.
description: Self-guided wine tasting event along Miracle Mile with participating restaurants and shops offering wine samples and small bites. Ticket includes tasting glass.

title: Edgewater Sunset Cruise
shortWhy: Biscayne Bay by boat as the sun goes down.
editorialWhy: BYOB sailboat cruise that actually sails (not just motors). Small group, good vibes. Book the 5pm slot for the best sunset timing this time of year.
description: Small group sailing excursion on Biscayne Bay. BYOB encouraged. See the Miami skyline and waterfront mansions from the water. Experienced captain provided.

title: Perez Art Museum Free Third Thursday
shortWhy: World-class museum, free entry, bayfront views.
editorialWhy: PAMM's architecture alone is worth the visit. Third Thursday includes DJ sets and cash bar on the terrace. The hanging gardens are incredible at sunset.
description: Free admission evening at PAMM with extended hours, live music, and special programming. Museum store and Verde restaurant open late.

title: Midtown Comedy Night
shortWhy: Miami's best comedy room, intimate and actually funny.
editorialWhy: The intimate setting means everyone gets a great view. Tuesday lineups often include touring comedians working out new material. Two drink minimum keeps it accessible.
description: Stand-up comedy showcase featuring local and touring comedians. Two-drink minimum. Full bar available. Early arrival recommended for best seating.

title: Allapattah Food Hall Opening
shortWhy: Former warehouse turned food destination in up-and-coming hood.
editorialWhy: Allapattah is having a moment and this food hall is ground zero. Caribbean, Venezuelan, and Filipino vendors under one roof. The natural wine bar upstairs is a sleeper hit.
description: Curated food hall featuring diverse local vendors, bars, and community space. Live music weekends. Part of the evolving Allapattah arts district.

title: South Beach Volleyball League
shortWhy: Casual beach volleyball with actual league competition.
editorialWhy: Not as intimidating as it sounds. The recreational division is genuinely welcoming to newer players. Games end just as the sunset peaks.
description: Co-ed recreational beach volleyball league. Registration open for individuals or teams. All skill levels welcome in rec division.

title: Overtown Soul Food Festival
shortWhy: Historic neighborhood celebrates its culinary legacy.
editorialWhy: Overtown was Miami's Black entertainment district when the Beach was segregated. This festival honors that history with incredible food and music. Go hungry.
description: Annual celebration of Southern and soul food traditions in historic Overtown. Live music, cooking demonstrations, local vendors.

title: Brickell Fitness Bootcamp
shortWhy: Wake up with a waterfront workout before the heat hits.
editorialWhy: The island setting makes this feel like a retreat, not a workout. Bring water, the instructor doesn't mess around. Great way to start a Saturday.
description: High-intensity outdoor fitness class on Brickell Key with views of the bay and downtown skyline. All fitness levels accommodated.

title: Arsht Center Jazz Roots
shortWhy: World-class jazz in a world-class venue.
editorialWhy: The Arsht's Jazz Roots series consistently books legends. The acoustics in Knight Concert Hall are exceptional. Dress up a bit—it's an occasion.
description: Acclaimed jazz performance series at Miami's premier performing arts center. Pre-show dining available at on-site restaurants.

title: Coconut Grove Brunch Crawl
shortWhy: Hit multiple brunch spots in walkable Coconut Grove.
editorialWhy: The Grove is compact enough to brunch-hop. Start at Greenstreet for coffee, move to Ariete for the main event, end at Lokal for a nightcap mimosa.
description: Self-guided brunch tour through Coconut Grove's top restaurants. Each participating venue offers a special small plate and drink pairing.

title: Wynwood Walls Free Tour
shortWhy: Get the backstory on Miami's most Instagrammed murals.
editorialWhy: Yes, you can just walk through on your own, but the guided tour reveals which artists did what and why. Book the morning tour to beat the crowds.
description: Guided walking tour of Wynwood Walls and surrounding street art. Learn about the artists, techniques, and stories behind the murals.

title: South Beach Food Tour
shortWhy: Skip the tourist traps, eat where locals actually go.
editorialWhy: South of Fifth is the locals' South Beach. This tour hits the spots that don't need to advertise. Come hungry—portions are generous.
description: Walking food tour through South of Fifth neighborhood, visiting local restaurants and hidden gems away from the tourist crowds.

title: Full Moon Drum Circle
address: 4020 Virginia Beach Dr, Key Biscayne, FL 33149
shortWhy: Beach drumming under the full moon—pure Miami.
editorialWhy: Bring a blanket, maybe some wine (be discreet), and join the rhythm. No drumming experience needed, plenty of people just vibe. Parking is limited, carpool.
description: Monthly gathering on the beach for drumming, dancing, and community under the full moon. Bring your own instruments or just come to enjoy.

title: Wynwood Art District Mural Workshop
shortWhy: Learn spray can technique from actual Wynwood artists.
editorialWhy: Not just a tourist gimmick—the instructors are working muralists. You'll leave with a small canvas piece. Fun for a date or solo adventure.
description: Hands-on workshop learning street art techniques including spray paint, stencils, and wheat paste. All materials provided. Take home your creation.

title: Biscayne Bay Kayak Eco Tour
shortWhy: Paddle through preserved mangroves and see old Miami.
editorialWhy: The Deering Estate is like Vizcaya's less famous sibling, but with better nature access. The kayak tour goes through pristine mangrove forests. Wildlife guaranteed.
description: Guided kayak tour through Biscayne Bay's mangrove waterways. Naturalist guide provides information about local ecosystem and wildlife.

title: Little Havana Cigar Rolling Demo
shortWhy: Watch master torcedores roll cigars the traditional way.
editorialWhy: This family operation has been hand-rolling cigars for decades. The demonstration is fascinating whether you smoke or not. Buy a few to support the craft.
description: Watch skilled cigar rollers demonstrate traditional Cuban cigar-making techniques. Brief history included. Cigars available for purchase.
